verbose_text: IFN-gamma ligand binding to its receptor induces Janus kinase 1/2 mediated tyrosine phosphorylation and subsequent dimerization of STAT1, which binds as a homodimer to cis elements known as IFN-gamma-activated sites in the promoter of target M1 signature genes [e.g., NOS2, IL-12, and class II transactivator (CIITA)].
evidence: tyrosine phosphorylation and subsequent dimerization of STAT1
